name: Glazed Sweet and Sour Chicken Wings
author: Nancy
summary: These sweet and sour chicken wings are one of my family's favorites. The recipe has been passed among many friends and relatives. Originally intended as an appetizer, we prefer it as a main dish served with rice or noodles.
ingredients: 3 pounds chicken wings, cut at joints, wing tips discarded
½ cup vegetable oil for frying, or as needed
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Pat wings dry and sprinkle with salt
Roll wing sections in cornstarch until all are coated
Dip in beaten eggs until coated evenly
Heat oil in a large frying pan to about 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Deep fry 4 to 6 wings at a time in the hot oil until light golden brown, about 5 minutes
Drain on paper towels then transfer to a shallow baking pan
Combine jelly, sugar, vinegar, soy sauce, ketchup, and lemon juice in a small saucepan and heat to boiling, stirring constantly
Lower heat and simmer until all jelly is dissolved, about 10 minutes
Bake in the preheated oven until wings are browned, no longer pink in the centers, and juices run clear, 30 to 40 minutes
